answer: Go around the back. Go around the back. My wife's asleep. She left supper out. Come and have something to eat.

question: No, I...
answer: We'll talk in the kitchen. Come and have something to eat.

question: Congratulations. Haven't seen a guy like you since me. You'll be transferred to Internal Investigations but you will continue to work right where you are in the Special Investigation Unit.

question: We are all convinced that Costello has at least one mole in the Special Investigation Unit.
answer: Right.

question: You'll investigate. Everybody. Anybody.

question: We have considered all possible candidates. You have an immaculate record. Some people never trust a guy with an immaculate record. I do. I have an immaculate record. Play golf?

question: That's a pity. Pretty much sucks as a game but you get to form relationships. How's the wedding coming along?
answer: Everything's great. On schedule. She's a doctor.

answer: Oh, it's working. Overtime.

answer: Would you like a cup of tea?

answer: Do you want some...

question: Sugar? No...

question: Move in with your boyfriend?

question: Better safe than sorry, I suppose.

question: I look around at your guys. They're all murderers right? I think "could I do murder?" And all I can answer myself is, "what's the difference".

question: Yeah, that's my point. You accuse me once, I put up with it. You accuse me twice, I quit. If you make me fear for my life, I put a fucking bullet in your head as if you were anybody else.

question: You're seventy fucking years old. One of these guys is going to pop you. As for running drugs, what the fuck. You don't need the pain in the ass, and they're going to catch you. And you don't need the money.

answer: Morning. A problem?

Follow Costello and you'll find his informer.

question: Of course I know how to spot a cop.

answer: You were fucking followed.

question: Jesus Christ.

I told him I would but I don't know if I would. Now I know I can't. I've done a lot of bad things but I've never been a murderer. Hey Billy, I don't want no one to put me in a dumpster. Just don't put me in a dumpster.

question: Yeah, so?

question: No.
answer: A better question is why your fuckers were following him.

question: Don't worry. I'll take care of it. Sweetheart, you're giving me a hard- on. Hey, watch your fucking mouth.

answer: He's waited a long time for you. (COLIN looks up and sees

question: I can't begin to tell you what a debt we owe you. I want you to know I'll be recommending you for the Medal of Merit. It's the highest honor we got.

question: All right, Bill. Just give me a minute. I'm gonna go in the other room. This computer's gone blooey on me.

question: I know. I'm not here to...I'm not here for that. I've got something to...to give to you...something I need you to keep. For me.

question: I need you to be my friend here and not ask any questions. That's for you to hold. Only you. Open this if I'm dead or if I call you and tell you to open it. Please do exactly what it says. Exactly what it says, please.

question: I'm sorry to show up here like this. There was no one else I could give it to. I'm sorry. There was no one else.

question: I was dreaming I was dead.

question: What's this?
answer: Open it

question: Really?
answer: Yeah.

question: You're joking...

question: What? Your guys shouldn't have done that.

question: He's fucking resigning. He put his papers in. He's not talking.

question: I can explain.
answer: Costello recorded everything. He put all the tapes in a little box and kept them with his lawyer. That was his insurance. His lawyer came to me. Costello trusted me the most. Imagine that you rat fuck. Sound quality good enough? I was a little worried.

question: Where are you?

question: Did we not talk about this? This is my job.
